title: ANF seizes over 92 kg drugs; arrests seven drug traffickers
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 24 (APP):Anti-Narcotics Force (ANF) while conducting seven operations across the country managed to recover over 92 kgs drugs worth more than Rs 18.5 million and arrested seven drug traffickers including two females.
According to an ANF Headquarters spokesperson, in an operation near a university on Jhang Road, Faisalabad, 8.8 kgs ice drug was recovered from the possession of an accused.
The arrested accused confessed selling drugs to the students of educational institutions.
In second operation at a courier office in Karachi, 17.750 kgs ice soaked in carpet was recovered from a parcel sent from Quetta destined for Australia.
From a courier office on Peshawar Ring Road, 7.2 kgs hashish was seized from a parcel destined for Lahore.
In 4th operation near GT Road, Attock, 2.4 kgs hashish was confiscated from the possession of two women.
In an operation in the Bonistan area of Panjgur, 36 kgs hashish hidden for smuggling was recovered.
Near Colonel Sher Khan Toll Plaza, Peshawar, 16.8 kgs hashish was recovered from a vehicle and two suspects were sent behind the bars.
In 7th operation near Iqbal Shaheed Toll Plaza, GT Road, Attock, 5.5 kgs hashish was recovered from a rickshaw and two drug traffickers were apprehended.
Cases have been registered under the CNS Act against the arrested accused, informed the spokesperson.
